tuv.seg: It is bordered by Italy to the west, Austria to the north, Hungary to the northeast, Croatia to the southeast, and the Adriatic Sea to the southwest.
Slovenes constitute over 80% of the country's population.
Slovenia has a predominantly temperate continental climate, with the exception of the Slovene Littoral and the Julian Alps.
The Julian Alps in the northwest have an alpine climate. Toward the northeastern Pannonian Basin, a continental climate is more pronounced.
